/* Dairy milk alternatives */ italics for terms
/* Dairy milk alternatives */ not a complete list
/* Dairy milk alternatives */ EU regs, vat-grown stuff included
/* Distribution */Put a dot in the word 'UK' as it is an abbreviation.
/* Varieties and brands */Put a dot in the word 'UK' as it is an abbreviation.
/* Possible harms */ rv speculation, outdated sources, primary research as unencyclopedic
/* Milk and bone strength */ trim to one [[WP:MEDRS]] [[meta-analysis]] which is dubious at 9 years out of date, [[WP:MEDDATE]]; the rest are not reviews and are unencyclopedic

/* Possible harms */ The Swedish study refers to HIGH milk consumption, not simply milk consumtion. Moreover, the study was only observational (and as far as I know, not confirmed by other studies). Cautious interpretation was recommended by the authors. E.g., they did not take into account how much sugar (or whatever else) they added or ate together with milk... Please feel free to delete the entire paragraph, if you cannot find additional and more compelling evidence by other authors.
/* Possible harms */ Casein is not an exorphin

/* Nutrition and health */ Calcium absorption studies belong in a separate subsection (similar to "Milk and bone strength"). Similarly, medical research about Listeria infection in infants belongs into subsection "Possible harms"
Improving readability of paragraph about lactase persisence.
Moved the sentence about increased risk of death to the appropriate section.
Added two arguments why drinking milk is so abnormal.
Made some adjustments to the text about milk and bone strength and moved it to a distinct sub-section.
